content: I've wanted to join the Marines since I was a little kid. I knew once I got 18 thats where I was going. Now im afraid I might not be able to because of my condition. I have anxiety/ocd. Not sure which one haha. But I take zoloft for it. Ive seen doctors about this so now its on my medical records. Can I get a waiver for this when I get better? Or am I permanently disqualified?
reply: I've wanted to join the Marines since I was a little kid. I knew once I got 18 thats where I was going. Now im afraid I might not be able to because of my condition. I have anxiety/ocd. content: Go here: "Recruiting Questions" http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/frm/f/78192862 Good luck to you. Don Proud father of a US Marine, Cpl, AAVs

title: Question about joining.

content: I just finished the hole pre-bootcamp routine. All the papers, test, physicals. My ship date is May 11 I personally wouldlnt use what the web page tells you for that question. I would contact your local recruiter. He will have all the answers. Just walk right into the office or fill out a form on marines.com and somebody will call you within the next 2days. GOOD LUCK
reply: I just finished the hole pre-bootcamp routine. All the papers, test, physicals. My ship date is May 11 I personally wouldlnt use what the web page tells you for that question.
